results.title: [Influence of therapy with atenolol on lethality of patients with chronic heart failure].
results.text_hl: The paper demonstrates that the hydrophilic beta-adrenoblocker (BAB) @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ is effective in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with III-IV functional class chronic @DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@heart failure@@@ (@DISEASE_Heart_Failure @DISEASE_MESH:D006333 @@@CHF@@@), associated with postinfarction cardiosclerosis (PIC) and @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002311 @@@dilatational cardiomyopathy@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002311 @@@DC@@@).

citations.NLM: Syrkina EA, Vyshinskaia ID, Aleksinskaia TV, Syrkin AL. [Influence of therapy with atenolol on lethality of patients with chronic heart failure]. Klin Med (Mosk). 2005;83(4):23-8. PMID: 15941137

results.title: Role of the Frank-Starling mechanism during maximal semisupine exercise after oral atenolol.
results.text_hl: We conclude that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ changes the left ventricular response to maximal semisupine exercise in normal man, with @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathy_Dilated</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D002311 @@@dilatation@@@ and a concomitant increase in systolic @DISEASE_Heart_defects_limb_shortening @DISEASE_MESH:C535850 @@@myocardial shortening@@@.
